title: How to Delete a Contact on iPhone: Quick & Easy Guide

steps.title: Open the Contacts app.
steps.content: Open the Contacts app. It's an app with a person-shaped silhouette on a grey background and colored tabs along the right side. [1] X Research source Alternatively, you can access Contacts from the Phone app by tapping the Contacts icon at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap a contact's name.
steps.content: Tap a contact's name. Doing so will open their contact page. To search for a specific contact, tap the Search bar at the top of the screen and type in their name.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . It's in the upper-right corner of the screen. This will let you make changes to this person's contact page, including deleting the contact altogether.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Delete Contact.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Delete Contact . It's at the bottom of the contact's page. If you don't see this, make sure you're at the very bottom of the page.

steps.title: Tap Delete Contact again when prompted.
steps.content: Tap Delete Contact again when prompted. You'll see this prompt at the bottom of the screen. After doing so, the contact will be deleted from your iPhone. If your iPhone is connected to your iCloud account , the contact will be deleted on all your connected devices.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. It's a grey app containing gears that's typically located on the home screen. This method will delete all contacts synced to your iPhone from your iCloud.

steps.title: Tap your Apple ID.
steps.content: Tap your Apple ID. It's the section at the top of the menu that contains your name and image if you've added one. If you are not signed in, tap Sign in to (Your Device) , enter your Apple ID and password, then tap Sign In . If you are running an older version of iOS, you may not need to do this step. In the most recent versions of iOS, this is called your Apple Account instead of your Apple ID.

steps.title: Tap iCloud.
steps.content: Tap iCloud . It's in the second section of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Show All.
steps.content: Tap Show All . This will expand the Apps Using iCloud section.

steps.title: Toggle off "Contacts".
steps.content: Toggle off "Contacts". It will turn grey, and you will be prompted to delete all of the iCloud contacts stored locally on your iPhone.

steps.title: Tap Delete from My iPhone.
steps.content: Tap Delete from My iPhone . All of the contacts that you had synced with your iCloud account will be deleted from your iPhone. These contacts include any locally saved information (e.g., manually added contacts).

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. It's a grey app containing gears that's typically located on the home screen. This method will delete all contacts synced to your iPhone from your email accounts.

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . If you have an older version of iOS, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Contacts.
steps.content: Tap Contacts . You may need to scroll down to find this.

steps.title: Tap Accounts.
steps.content: Tap Accounts . It's at the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap an email account.
steps.content: Tap an email account. All email accounts added to your iPhone can be found under the Accounts header. For example, you'd tap Gmail to open your Contacts settings for a Gmail account.

steps.title: Toggle off "Contacts".
steps.content: Toggle off "Contacts". It will turn grey, and the contacts from the email account will no longer appear in your iPhone's Contacts app.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. It's the grey app containing gears that's typically located on the home screen.

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . If you have an older version of iOS, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Contacts.
steps.content: Tap Contacts . You may need to scroll down to find this.

steps.title: Tap Siri.
steps.content: Tap Siri . This is at the top of the page. Some iOS versions may show Siri & Search instead.

steps.title: Toggle off "Show Contact Suggestions".
steps.content: Toggle off "Show Contact Suggestions". This is towards the bottom of the screen. Siri will stop providing contact suggestions in other apps.

steps.title: Separate your contacts into lists.
steps.content: Separate your contacts into lists. You can create lists for your family, your business associates, your friends from the gym, etc. That way, you can hide entire categories of contacts from the list without having to remove them completely. To create a new list, do the following: Open the Contacts app. Tap Lists in the top-left corner. Tap Add List . Enter a name and tap done . Tap the list, and then tap Add Contacts . Select the contacts you want to add and tap Done .

steps.title: Open the Contacts app.
steps.content: Open the Contacts app. When you open the app again, it should default to the last list opened.

steps.title: Tap List.
steps.content: Tap List . This is in the top-left corner. You'll see all your lists here.

steps.title: Tap a list to view it.
steps.content: Tap a list to view it. As long as you're in a list, you won't see other contacts not added to the list.

steps.title: Swipe left on the list if you want to delete it.
steps.content: Swipe left on the list if you want to delete it. Swipe left and tap the trash can icon. Tap Delete to confirm.

steps.title: How do I delete multiple contacts on my iPhone?
steps.content: How do I delete multiple contacts on my iPhone? There's no way to delete multiple contacts at a time. You'll need to delete contacts one by one. For a quicker shortcut, tap and hold the contact in the Contacts app, and then tap Delete .

steps.title: Will deleting contacts from iPhone delete from iCloud?
steps.content: Will deleting contacts from iPhone delete from iCloud? If you have iCloud Contacts enabled, deleting contacts from your iPhone will delete contacts on your iCloud and synced devices. If you don't want this, disable Contacts syncing in your iCloud settings first.
